comment._content: Ah! beachcombing ... a life not wasted. There's some discussion (and hilarious comments) over on YouTube about which Bangor the song was about. Evidently inspired by a trip to Rhyl in north Wales, but that didn't rhyme - youtu.be/T8WiPy1xSkw.

comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/8468254@N02] But all the other buildings have survived (apart from the bandstand)

comment._content: Any O'Dea photos in the Pipeline NLI? :)

comment.author: 30622421@N03
comment._content: I have 65 year old photos of my husband and his siblings on that piece of sand with their backs to the wall. It is all carpark and marina now.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/88162413@N06] Yes! Tune in to this Bat Channel next week... :)
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 77199267@N03
comment._content: The McKee Clock Tower, constructed 1915, now stands on the site of the bandstand. Doesn't really help with the dating unfortunately.

comment.author: 77199267@N03
comment._content: Thomas Matthews, Coal Merchant is in both 1901 and 1911 censuses at Seacliffe Road

comment.author: 48236157@N02
comment._content: Definitely not Bangor Maine. Great photo!

comment.author: 30622421@N03
comment._content: According to my Bangor Gazateer the double gabled building with Pimms on it was built in 1895.

comment.author: 30622421@N03
comment._content: And the building which houses Mathews Coal merchant (No 6 Quay street  - 4 story single bay building) was built in 1900 and by 1910 had the Peveril House Hotel in it, and became the Rockview hotel in 1920. So this is post 1900 but pre-1910?

comment.author: 29492435@N02
comment._content: Victoria Restaurant is still serving up food as a chippy.

comment.author: 13073434@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/nlireland] You're quite right. The song is about Bangor in Wales. I must take a copy of the photo and try to replicate it.

comment.author: 77199267@N03
comment._content: The Mrs Arthur Hill Coates Memorial Fountain was made by Walter Macfarlane & Co of Glasgow who also made the canopy for the Olympia Theatre in Dublin and this very similar fountain in Glasgow

comment.author: 77199267@N03
comment._content: Here's a recent pic of the Coates fountain - not restored to the same standard as the Glasgow one unfortunately. They could start by getting rid of the bushes around it maps.google.com/maps?q=bangor+down&hl=en&ll=54.66...

comment.author: 91549360@N03
comment._content: Walter Macfarlane & Co also made the DunLaoghaire(Kingstown) Fountain [http://www.flickr.com/photos/infomatique/7939499664/]

comment.author: 77199267@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/91549360@N03] Nice! They really should do something about the Bangor one - it's lost in there behind the bushes and the white paint does nothing for it.
